info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued September 03 at 3:50PM EDT until September 04 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...High wave action, strong currents, and dangerous swimming conditions expected. Piers may be heavily swamped by waves. * WHERE...Mason, Oceana, Muskegon, Ottawa, Allegan and Van Buren counties. * WHEN...Through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Strong currents can pull swimmers into deeper water and high waves can sweep people off piers. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Southwest winds of 15 to 25 mph have produced wave heights of 3 to 6 feet. These conditions will persist through the night. Conditions will be hazardous to swimmers due to dangerous waves and currents. South sides of south piers will be dangerous places to swim through sunset. South Beach at South Haven, Grand Haven State Park and Pere Marquette Park in Muskegon will have dangerous conditions.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions and do not venture out on piers. Please check with your local authorities on potential beach closures.
